relevant_findings.HEENT: Sclera anicteric, MM dry, oropharynx clear, poor dentition, EOMI, PERRL, exophthalmos
relevant_findings.Neck: Supple, JVP not elevated, no LAD
relevant_findings.CV: Tachycardic but regular, normal S1 + S2, no murmurs, rubs, gallops
relevant_findings.Lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, no wheezes, rales, ronchi
relevant_findings.Abdomen: Soft, non-tender, non-distended, bowel sounds present, no organomegaly
relevant_findings.GU: Foley with very light yellow urine
relevant_findings.Extremities: Warm, well perfused, 2+ pulses, no clubbing, cyanosis or edema
relevant_findings.Neuro: A&O x3, CN III-XII grossly intact, grossly normal strength and sensation

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially the patient was only responding to painful stimuli but ended up following commands prior to transfer.
